00001 #include <CollectionHistogramer.hh>
00002 #include <vector>
00003 #include <EVENT/LCCollection.h>
00004 #include <EVENT/LCParameters.h>
00005 #include <iomanip>

00007 namespace CALICE {
00008 
00009   const char *CollectionHistogramer::__histogramTypeName[kNParMaps]={
00010     "Collections", 
00011     "Transient Collections",
00012     "Integer Parameters",
00013     "Float Parameters",
00014     "String Parameters"
00015   };
00016 
00017 
00018   // create instance to make this Processor known to Marlin
00019   CollectionHistogramer a_collection_histogramer;
00020 
00021   CollectionHistogramer::CollectionHistogramer() 
00022     : Processor("CollectionHistogramer")
00023   {
00024     _description = "Collect the names of all collections which exist in the lcio stream and histogram the number of elements." ;
00025 
00026     registerProcessorParameter( "HistogramEventParameters" , 
00027                                "If set to !=0 the event parameters are histogrammed." ,
00028                                _histogramParameters ,
00029                                0) ;
00030 
00031   }
00032 
00033   void CollectionHistogramer::init() {
00034     for (UInt_t hist_i=0; hist_i<kNParMaps; hist_i++) {
00035       _hist[hist_i].clear();
00036     }
00037   }
00038 
00039   //  void CollectionHistogramer::processRunHeader( LCRunHeader* run) { } 
00040 
00041   void CollectionHistogramer::processEvent( LCEvent * evtP ) {
00042     if (evtP) {
00043       
00044       // loop over all collections.
00045       // Currently, the only way to do this, is to get a list of all collection names
00046       // and than get one collection after the other.
00047       const std::vector<std::string>  *col_names=evtP->getCollectionNames();
00048       for (std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator col_name_iter=col_names->begin();
00049            col_name_iter!=col_names->end();
00050            col_name_iter++) {
00051 
00052         LCCollection* a_col = evtP->getCollection( *col_name_iter ) ;
00053 
00054         // add collection to map or if it already exists collect statistics about the number of elements in the collection
00055         if (a_col->isTransient()) {
00056           _hist[kTransientCollectionMap][*col_name_iter].add(a_col->getNumberOfElements(),1.);
00057         }
00058         else {
00059           _hist[kCollectionMap][*col_name_iter].add(a_col->getNumberOfElements(),1.);
00060         }
00061       }
00062       if (_histogramParameters!=0) {
00063         lcio::StringVec keys;
00064         evtP->getParameters().getIntKeys(keys);
00065         for (lcio::StringVec::const_iterator key_iter=keys.begin();
00066              key_iter!=keys.end();
00067              key_iter++) {
00068           _hist[kIntParMap][*key_iter].add(evtP->getParameters().getNInt(*key_iter));
00069         }
00070         keys.clear();
00071         evtP->getParameters().getFloatKeys(keys);
00072         for (lcio::StringVec::const_iterator key_iter=keys.begin();
00073              key_iter!=keys.end();
00074              key_iter++) {
00075           _hist[kFloatParMap][*key_iter].add(evtP->getParameters().getNFloat(*key_iter));
00076         }
00077         keys.clear();
00078         evtP->getParameters().getStringKeys(keys);
00079         for (lcio::StringVec::const_iterator key_iter=keys.begin();
00080              key_iter!=keys.end();
00081              key_iter++) {
00082           _hist[kStringParMap][*key_iter].add(evtP->getParameters().getNString(*key_iter));
00083         }
00084       }
00085     }
00086   }
00087 
00088   void CollectionHistogramer::end() {
00089 
00090     std::cout << "---  " << name() << " Report :" << std::endl;
00091 
00092     // get the length of the longest collection name
00093     // used below for output formatting
00094     UInt_t size=0;
00095     for (UInt_t hist_i=0; hist_i<kNParMaps; hist_i++) {
00096       if (_hist[hist_i].size()==0) continue;
00097 
00098       for(std::map<std::string,Average_t>::iterator col_stat_iter=_hist[hist_i].begin();
00099           col_stat_iter!=_hist[hist_i].end();
00100           col_stat_iter++) {
00101         if (col_stat_iter->first.size()>size) size=col_stat_iter->first.size();
00102       }
00103       std::cout << " -  " << __histogramTypeName[hist_i] << " :" << std::endl;
00104       // print the names of all collections in the stream and print the number of occurances and the 
00105       // min/mean/max number of elements which have been stored in the collection.
00106       for(std::map<std::string,Average_t>::iterator col_stat_iter=_hist[hist_i].begin();
00107           col_stat_iter!=_hist[hist_i].end();
00108           col_stat_iter++) {
00109         col_stat_iter->second.calculate();
00110         std::cout << std::setw(size) << col_stat_iter->first << ":" << col_stat_iter->second << std::endl;
00111       }
00112       std::cout << std::endl;
00113     }
00114   }
00115 }
